channel.title: Favorite Subject
channel.description:
Right now I'm getting prepared for a really big test tomorrow, which is going to include detailed content starting from the foundation of Jamestown and branching all the way to the Navigation Acts.
History is my favorite subject, but there are so many little details that are very important, which can easily lead to failure or a misunderstanding of the entire meaning of something. What's your favorite subject, and why?

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Games dev since theirs sexbox360s in the room. When we’ve done all our work for that day we usually go on them ;3. or I go on rs since its 1 xbox per 2 computers which means theirs a ratio of 1 xbox to 2 ppl and a lot of the good games are used by other ppl. Note to self : bring in my own games.
Btw gl on your test

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

With earlier history then the revolutions, you can actually understand how society changed and developed. It give you a better understand of how we came to be, instead of how countries decided they wanted to work differently.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

amy_webb: They do it simply to discourage people from criticizing the US. It is by propaganda they could hide the fact that only Romania is worse than them in relative child poverty (In the rich world).

The fun thing about history is to draw the lines forward to today. Seeing how events in the past change the world we live in today. With the middle ages you don’t have that effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

What i don’t understand about history is why people manipulate facts to suit themselves, as Niall saying, America did it with the world wars.

I was going to do history this year but i switched out of it because i don’t care for the Chinese revolution and such, if we learned middle age history it would be a lot more exciting.

Favorite subject would have to be media, just because my teacher rocks and we muck around filming all day.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

I hated History so much I dropped the subject for my final year.

Anyway, favorite subject has to be maths. I just liked it overall. I honestly don’t know how people can’t do it neither, I get so mad when they can’t add or work out something so simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’m quite fond of history, but what I’m more fond of is how nations tend to distort history to their own liking

e.g., america won the world war(s), russia defeated germany (which is partially true) etc

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Subject
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I think you should rename the topic to favorite subject.

Mine’s math, I forgot where I read this but there is one answer, but many ways to get to it. Plus I like doing math in general.

Read full topic
